showDescription: A weekly expedition into nocturnal atmospherics, from jazz noir and surf guitars to downtempo grooves and ambient moods.

showName: Morningstar: The Light In The Darkness
showDescription:
Morningstar: The Light In The Darkness is an exploration of the dark side of music, life, art, and culture, tracing the invisible lines of the paranormal, supernatural, and the occult through mainstream culture. 
We may be in the darkness, but we're looking for the light.
Dub is the deep exploration and exploitation of the easiet available musical tools. Dive In. Tune Out. Get In Deep. Music from both sides of the field. From dub to electro and all else deep.
Dub is the deep exploration and exploitation of the easiet available musical tools. Dive In. Tune Out. Get In Deep. Music from both sides of the field. From dub to electro and all else deep.

I want to broadcast a radio show that incorporates all genres of music. Put Hip-Hop along side Country, next to Brazilian Beat and Punk Rock. To color outside the lines, so to speak, and provide an eclectic "mix tape" of weirdness to the air waves. An analog groove to get ya in the right mood!

Feverish Tunes for All // Hip-Shakin' & Soul-Savin' Records from the '50s & '60s

Gospel // Rhythm & Blues // Garage Punk // Rockabilly // Soul // Blues // Doo Wop // Girl Group // Surf // Forever & Ever // Amen
the most sweet, delicious, and fattening tracks from all genres and all eras. it’s never to early for cake!
Ears in the Cornfield is a bouquet of music. Hand picked. Hand delivered.
A mix of current through 80s new wave, synth pop, electro and dance music.
Join Odd Monster on an eccentric exploration through music miscellany.  Expect deep pulls from all across the board: No genre is safe, no artist too famous nor obscure.
Local music and show information from Portland and surrounding areas
Local music and event announcements

We know that electronic music is largely dominated by white dudes; but let's explore the fantastic sounds made by women and people of color. Even though diversity is challenging to find among the labels, 'Instead of White Men' will highlight a wide-breadth of electronic music from ambient and experimental to world infusion to disco, house, and techno. Sounds will be heard, commentary will ensue, maybe even a track from a token white dude--who knows?

I have a very large collection of vinyl and I play only vinyl on the air. When I first got a show, Jess and Erik, who I know from Xray, told me to play whatever I wanted. I like to organize my shows around themes, e.g. records labels, tributes to recently deceased artists, topically relevant music or simply genre. I have programmed shows of country blues. psychedelic rock, progressive rock, jazz, R and B, funk, acid folk and more. The overwhelming majority of the material I program was recorded in the '60's and '70's so there is a consistent retro vibe to the show.

DJ Dan and Olives haul a milk crate full of records from their ever growing personal collection over to The Baker Building, and spin anything from their favorite krautrock, to soul and reggae, to ambient electronic, to bossa nova, to post-punk, to the best of Portland’s underground artists and bottom-shelf bargain bins.  Each show has a unique feel, and every record gets filed under various.

A vinyl show as eclectic as Portland’s record stores.

DJ Dan and Olives haul a milk crate full of records from their ever growing personal collection over to The Baker Building, and spin anything from their favorite krautrock, to soul and reggae, to ambient electronic, to bossa nova, to post-punk, to the best of Portland’s underground artists and bottom-shelf bargain bins.  Each show has a unique feel, and every record gets filed under various.
Expect unexpected themed shows weekly featuring Post-Punk, New Wave, Experimental, and Allsorts bookended by songs from The Cure.
Electronicaust. March to the beat of a programmed drum

The Funk Pharmacy gives listeners the best soul and funk music that they have ever heard, along with all of the cuts that they have never heard. Dr. Soul is cocked, locked, and ready to rock to fill your prescription when he jumps on the 1's and 2's. Jammin', rammin', and always slamming the hits through your speakers, he delivers what you need tight and right every time. Come get down to the greatest jams on the only station you need on your FM dial, 90.3 KFFP. Dig it, P-Town!

showName: If you Feel Like Letting Go
showDescription: Centered around shoegaze but also whatever feels right during the show.
21st-century auditory medicine show. avant-garde/experimental meanderings. collages of collaborative chaos.
Eclectic Static brings the obscure, the known, the rockers, the jammers, the chill, and the feels to all listeners.

Everything from folky to freaky to funky, and back again, it's the perfect mix to groove through your afternoon, with songs that you already love mixed with a heap of brand new tracks that are soon to become your new favorites.

Joshua Justice pulls from a cosmically bestowed record collection to bring you Static + Distance. Featuring hot tracks and savory licks from all eras, genres and dimensions with zero regard to the constructs of time, space or laws of physics. Expect heartbreakers, burners, shakers, bummers and more. Always solid jams.

Playing primarily physical media. Records and tapes.  Music is cheaper than therapy. Psych, Surf, Modern and old.  Music from across the globe will be played, as well as local favorites being highlighted.  All shapes and sizes of music will be included.  This hour will make the bummer summer slightly more bearable.  Focus is primarily on the jamz, with guest musicians coming in for interviews, discussions, playlists.

Highlighting new music from a variety of indie formats; from rock and folk, to soul, R&B or rap, as well as the occasional house track and remix "Under the Radar /On the Rise" aims to shine a light on a portion of music making a stir on the interwebs where mainstream radio stays mum.
60s/70s international 45s, primarily women.
An eclectic show that focuses on thematic connections between disparate genres, current non-mainstream music, and odd corners of the pop universe.
A weekly broadcast featuring soul, funk,post-punk, pop, French pop, skunk rock, doom metal, twee pop, gutter sludge and whatever else I feel like playing. Including disco.

Bizarro hip hop and weird beats. Eclectic show that explores the more experimental and soulful end of rap, synthwave, v a p o r w a v e, chiptunes and a variety of other beat-driven and sample-based genres.

Music,  interviews and more.

I interview bands,  play brand new songs & underground classics

A show dedicated to the underappreciated albums of years past, each week Under The Rug goes below the surface of rock history to examine should-be rock 'n' roll classics. Listeners will follow along with DJ Bare Bones and DJ Hunter as they shine a light on albums from the '60's through 80's that have fallen through the cracks of time and deserve greater examination through context of the band, the styles of the times, and the benefits of hindsight.

A weekly exploration of the cosmos through the vessel of music and half-baked musings. Hermetically Sealed presents an invocation to the universe in the form of a slopped together playlist. All songs chosen are inspired by current astrological transits.

Do you feel as passionate about Alexander O'Neal as you do about John Foxx? What do Human League and Janet Jackson have in common? Are you into that dank Italo? Minimal Wave? Wax Trax? This show is about those feels and more.

showName: It's a nice world to visit
showDescription: Punk, Post-Punk, Garage Rock, Psych…A mix of new tracks and old favorites.

Some noise, some rock, some drone, some familiar friends. Lotsa stuff that may only be interesting because it's actually now being played on the FM dial/has just been played next to something else/has been pulled out of context/is played at a different speed (with and without intention).
Chopped & Screwed New Wave

Music. Talk. Disabilities.

Full Life is an art, recreation, and vocational program for adults living with developmental disabilities based in Portland, OR. Every Tuesday and Wednesday we perform an improvised talk show together. We make up songs, take questions from our listeners, and talk about topics both serious and hilarious.

http://feeds.feedburner.com/fullliferadio
http://www.full-lifepdx.com
http://www.myspace.com/flashtvpdx
Yr Mom is a schiztastic show that goes from “A” to 3.14, then right over to Q. No rules, just rawk in its various forms. Listen to Yr Mom. She knows best.
Mostly black metal, some other stuff

We've done the show weekly focusing on darker, weirder corners of electronic music, mostly techno, electro and synthwave style.. occasionally we host guets and conduct lowkey interviews with local like-minded artists

DJ Nightchilde and Ian Hicks brings you a 2 hour weekly program of Concrète/Mutant/Metallic/Beat/TapeHiss/Acidic/BrainWave/Electroid/Technical/Experimentation

Alleys Of Your Mind
Every Wednesday 6pm-8pm PST

You can tune live on Freeform Portland 90.3 KFFP or 
www.freeformportland.org/show/alleys-of-your-mind/
"PopLife meanderings through the Interzone" is the goofy description that's up there now..
Electic
The yelling and the screaming and the distortion and the noise and the death and the doom and the melancholy and the mania and the ennui and the beat and the rhythm and the glitch and the dream.

C’mon, you can guess what it’s like. 

Dark ambient, sort of creepy, sometimes? Sure, of course. Post-rock, drone, grindcore, metal… sometimes. Sometimes there’s a little old-time song and dance number, and it can go… oh, anywhere from there. Spooky Southern gothic. “Electronica.” J-Pop and klezmer and hot club jazz. Cut-ups and mash-ups. Freak folk, psych rock. Field recordings… Hauntology. Lichenthropy. 

Sometimes it’s like getting a lap dance at the butoh performance. Bees in your heart, fleas up your spine. 

Rarely painful, more like an intermittent but persistent, muted drumming you can’t quite place. Something “else,” lodged up in there, and you don’t know if it’s digging its way out or digging in. 

Sometimes it skips, like a broken thing, like a heartbeat. 

You know what it’s like, don’t you?
Weekly roundup of all the best new rap and hiphop as well as old favorites and classics. Lots of underground and local artists! Often highlighting the best of the west coast and the south.
A mix of things to get you hyped for your late night adventures. A musical journey crossing all genres
Hip-hop Sets, Nu Disco//Electronic Sets & Heavier EDM.

The VoidCast was a short-lived conceptual podcast I developed in conjunction with my PDX-based, boutique record label Apneic Void Sounds. It consisted of conversations with creatives discussing the creative process, how one finds and maintains inspiration, what creatives do when they encounter a creative slump, and what drives their process forward. 
To bring the conceit of that podcast to air, I would curate programming around a short conversation with a local or touring creative that would address the topics outlined above. The music programming would include work by that creative, work that inspired that artist, and work I felt complimented or similarly was inspired by common aspects of the conversation.

An eclectic mix of new and old music.
Lots of local music, surf, soul, psych, hip-hop, modern funk, punk,synth wave, new wave, no wave and everything in between.

80's & 90's Alternative Rock / New Wave / Grunge / Shoegaze / Goth

All Vinyl. All Love. 
Hosted by
DJ Colin Jones (SNAP 90's, XRAY.fm, Ground Kontrol, Freeform Portland)

I love cloudy day alternative classics and I am obsessed with records.
For 10+ years I worked at record stores in Denver and Portland and the Big Green Jones Show is where I share the love <3
Irresponsible radio bouncy bouncy
Lucifer Rosa provides a conglomeration of miscellaneous doo-dads and knick knacks every Thursday from noon to 2.
Lo-fi bedroom pop, weirdo indie rock, and outsider music. Music to stare at your ceiling to. Music to braid your hair to. This show will make you believe in love again.
78s to space bloops, lots of shaking in between:::awe-dee-ooh yarns for  horologists
Eclectic variety with old soul tendencies

This is my current showDescription:
Playing early rock&roll, punk, girl-groups, glam, bubble gum and power pop to keep your life slightly tipsy in the best way possible. On a mission to get you sweet and sick.

I would keep that!  But if I were to get a show for the next round, I think I would want to keep each show a bit more focused and choose a theme for each.  This could be something broad like bands from a certain country, or a very specific genre, or a broad theme like "songs about _______".  I think working with a theme would keep it more focused and get me to delve in deeper to the genres/artists that I already love  and find new ones too. as well as keep the show more interesting for the listener.  I also had a few guests in over the past few months and I enjoyed collaborating with them on playlists too, so I would like to have more guests as well this time around!
Rock & Roll -  Classic rock, Prog and Psych. Vintage inspired and as faded as your ol' blue jeans.
’70s/’80s post-punk obscurities, DIY pop eccentrics, forgotten women of the underground, demos from the newest noisemaking upstarts & more.

My show is a mixtape style show, where each week has a theme but it can vary greatly from week to week. Music selection also varies greatly (but tends to stay in a more contemporary, dreamy, sadpop realm). Shows thus far have included modern boogie, Pride, and grandpa-themed.
A tapestry of folk and folk-rock, industrial and noise, ambient and experimental sounds, post-punk and synth-wave, and the mysteries that connect them.

I am DJ D || For Two Hours || Everything Electronic. 

The Geeks Were Right is devoted to spinning electronic music spanning from the earliest electronic music to now. Hear tracks from the underground, the obscure and experimental; to the latest, most popular tracks being played today. Tune in to hear electronic music from your neighbors down the street to artists from all across the world.

The Geeks Were Right will always cover the ever growing range of electronic music from Glitch, IDM, Coldwave, Electropop, Disco, Krautrock, Folktronica, Spacerock, Dub, Chillwave, House and so much more.
Please enjoy this mix of music to make pyramids to. While eclectic, your record Selectrix, DJ Kittybot, leans towards minimal electronics, ambient, noise, and noisy rock.
Exploring the various strands of electronic music whether it's warm analog house, the pounding percussion of techno, the frenzy of footwork and juke, and more.
An homage to the late 60s/early 70s FM underground rock stations.
Lots of French and Other Stuff
A stream of consciousness; noise-rock, goth-punk, electronic, metal, indie-pop, industrial-noise, rock, shoe-gaze and aural esoteric delights.

Terminal Beach explores the multi-faceted and ever-evolving field of electronic music. Primarily techno, house, bass, electro, industrial, beats, experimental/abstract, and ambient styles. We also seek to host a variety of local artists and DJs for live performances, and to shine a light on local and international record labels and music scenes/collectives.

WHOA THIS IS HEAVY with DJ zen_hound focuses on the heavy music scenes, labels and venues of the Pacific Northwest. From Corvallis to Vancouver B.C., underground metal, punk and noise are Cascadian treasures waiting to be unearthed.

Mudclub, Berghain, Batcave, Clit Club, The Spectrum, and now Club Mate. Sexy music for the glittering, revolutionary, downtown crowd. Current and classic cuts across genre. 

MUSIC IS OUR WEAPON. MUSIC IS THEE COMMON DENOMINATOR. OUR RELIGION IS BEAUTY. WE WIELD ONLY THE SWORD OF FLAWLESSNESS. OUR ANGER IS OUTWEIGHED ONLY BY OUR DESIRE FOR GORGEOUSNESS. WE'VE COME TO DESTROY THE MAN, RECLAIM THE FEMININE IDENTITY, AND ANCHOR THE WHITE LIGHT FOR ALL BEINGS. WE CONSCIOUSLY ERADICATE THE FEAR WE'VE BEEN PROGRAMMED TO HAVE IN OUR HEARTS, AND THAT'S WHY WE'RE SO MUTHAFUCKIN BAD.

This is our soundtrack.

Sludge. Vogue. House. Deathrock. Doom. Digital Hardcore. Italo Disco. Industrial. New Age. New Romantic. Punk. Avant Garde. Techno. Rave. Ambient. Yé-yé Grrrl. Hip Hop. Trip Hop. Dub. Voodoo. Acid. Ecstasy. Animals. High Heels. Long Nails. Shaved Headed Girls and Longhaired Boys. Whatever.
Where the Traffic Goes is a radio program that plays the best in classic UK and US indiepop, punk rock, '60s heartbreak, DIY noise, and '80s underground.
A weekly show focusing on all live music from a broad spectrum of genres.
House, Techno, Electro, Freestyle and Disco in the mix every Friday night from 8-10pm, with your host DJ Christopher LaRose and guest mixes from DJs near and far.

This is a dense and diverse assortment of racket, running the gamut but skewing raucous.  60s innovators, 70s glam and punk, 80s hardcore and post-punk, 90s noise and beyond.  An old punker tries to make sense of it all.  It’s a punk show.

Allow me to be your soundtrack as your Friday night turns into Saturday. Enjoy some real vibey grooves — an eclectic mix of new & old-school psychedelic, soul, trip-hop, indie, electronica and beyond — Get ready to find yourself in a makeout sesh.

djName: Dj Image Research & DJ Life Couch
showDescription:
Combining the forces of "Gammasphere" host, DJ Image Research (Hunter P. Thompson) and Psychic Estates host, DJ Life Couch (Wyatt Schaffner) 

Exploring worlds of experimental house, abstract techno lounge, neo jazz funk, coastal ambience, outernational rhythm, slank groove, outsider acid, balearic beats, future breaks, jungle fusion.

Teenage Depression with Suzanne Bummers focuses on 77-81 punk, post punk, 60s fuzzy garage and anything that breaks yours heart. Brief discussions on topics such as the Portland music scene and current events sporadically pop up.
Bumping reggae,dub,roots,rocksteasy jams for all to enjoy
My specialties are Garage, Punk, Post Punk, Mod Revival and Glam. Mostly rare 45s and obscure artists.
Showcasing underground music from cities in the US and Internationally. All music will come from a donation or cost free site such as Bandcamp, Soundcloud, etc.

Weekend Family Music Hour is children led by DJs Opal & Ayler who are 7 & 9 yrs old. They are supervised by Mom (Karen) & we play eclectic music which ranges from ethnic, Miami bass, soul, funk, rock, psych, hip hop, reggae, jazz & folk. Birthday shout outs with Miami Bass song by Luke Skywalker, "It's Your Birthday." Child led discussions on politics, magic and childhood subjects.

We bring our Moog in for ambience on holidays or special occasions.

They say that variety is the spice of life and that is exactly what makes our show so great. The After Party is a variety show consisting of around 50% Talk and 50% Music and every week we have a different theme. One week we may play 80's music... the next it could be Ska... or even requested cover songs. We always keep the topics lighthearted so you can sit back relax and have some fun.
Tune in for 2 hours of whacked out 45s from the 50s and 60s! Expect a smorgasbord of tunes from soul, r&b, garage, rockabilly, doo wop and blues!

1/3 conversation and 2/3 music, Bachelard’s Panty Drawer explores a particular theme for each show (work, ambition, dreams, birth, money, pre-history, black holes, romance, happiness, domestication, etc.) that drives both the conversation and playlist. Conversations are between Mammal in Crime (Felicity Fenton) and various artists/writers/musicians/thinkers. The music is eclectic and taps into multiple genres.

Deep Lez Power Hour provides the soundtrack to the early thirties lesbian odyssey you didn’t know you were on. 

Songs will include 
•Tracks from the mix cd you made your ex girlfriend and are finally letting yourself listen to again 
•Karaoke jams that strengthen your female friendships 
•Dance numbers from that one time you went out to Holocene 
•Break up tunes 
•Your mom’s old records 
•Music you can journal to 

Plus: Story time!

The goal of this program will be to take the listeners on an adventure across musical styles and time. This wide-ranging mix will hop across genres as diverse as cosmic American, psychedelic, all varieties of jazz, American primitive, soul, and garage. However, hopping to these genres will not be the extent of the journey as the goal of the program will be to use any means necessary (e.g., a pogo stick, time-traveling Delorean, amphibious vehicle, etc.) to scour the musical universe to bring back entertaining and interesting sounds to the audience.

An intoxicating mix of psychedelic and experimental sounds, past and present. Expect krautrock/kosmische nuggets, modal acid folk & weirdlore, hauntological delights, pop-sike pipe-dreams, radiophonics & analog electronics, surreal sound collages & drones, progressive/avant-rock oddities, and unusual international sounds.
Music. Wide genre of things, Outlaw Country, Soul, Post Punk, Sludge.
80's pop specifically from latinoamerica.
Mystery vibrations from the party dimension

Music to tuck your shirt in and jam culture to: a tribute to all the delights of creative music and audio experimentation, some of which sounds like songs — some of which tastes like As Seen On TV artifacts

You think I think I know things; 
but YOU know I know differently...
I mean, 
(well, you know what I mean, -or DO you?)
It's all in your mind, 
-that place where people go,
to say that they are someone thinking something, 
about,-something they think they are thinking about someone,
& I'm here to PROVE it to you.
It's all in those or-ga-nyezzzzzzd nnotes you see,
(see?)
JUST...lllike,
MEE-YEWZICK.
It's late and things are getting weird on Freeform Portland. Princess Dude and Scarlett take you wherever the mind goes when it's past your bedtime and all the bars are closed.

I'd like to showcase my collection of novelty records if no other comedy music programming is in line to compete. I believe my library to be a bit more highbrow than Dr. Demento's song parodies and old-timey review. I have also worked as a video jockey in Portland 3-4 nights a week for 10 years, having begun as a vinyl DJ at weekly open turntable events. I have curated a sizable library for my mobile music video museum Eye Candy VJs, which has been featured at Hollywood Theater, Dig a Pony, Century Bar, Sandy Hut, Beulahland, The Know, Firkin Tavern, Fez Ballroom, Triple Nickel and quite a few more.
Sonic density for the up-at-4AM set
Sonic sprawl of timely rock n' roll for my buds

Tune in each Sunday from 6:00 to 8:00 a.m. for new wave, glam, protopunk and postpunk done the RCH way. Depth, not breadth. New-to-you or a just a new view on an old favorite. The streets are slick… hold onto the rails! On twitter: @rgbbyrch

Music Of Our Time

https://www.mixcloud.com/Swintronix/
https://www.facebook.com/staticatomizer/
https://ello.co/swintronix
http://www.freeformportland.org/show/static-atomizer-w-dj-swintronix/
Everyone's a little bit of a bummer deep down. At Therapy, being a bummer is encouraged, with a full hour (?) of downtrodden tunes fit to wallow to.
Moody, murky, and a little dark.

We, Ben Glas and Samson Stilwell, would like to propose a bimonthly (twice a month) show that invites musicians and sound artists to either perform live or create an installation (either physically in the studio or conceptually through the presented work) to be documented on air and archived for later retrieval. Our plan is to invite one artist or collaborative team each month for one installment and replay the initial live recording for the second show of the month.

Music from planet earth, past, present and future.

Always searching for the perfect groove, tune in and lets find it together.
Music that searches for connections between seemingly disparate genres -expect to hear lots of modern classical, other instrumental musics, post-punk, power pop, and jazz.

A bi-weekly program focusing on capturing an event split of mood and nostalgia through sounds, musical and otherwise, which is inherently linked to the underground and/or counter-cultural movements of the last 50 years.
A potpourri of sound: electronic, lo-fi, folk, hip hop, indie, punk rock

Music. All about the music. Many parts of the usual elements of the show aka cover of the week, the smiths feature, etc come from my music blog (3 years strong at unclaimedbaggagemusic.com). In the daytime, I work as a music promoter for radio. Some of my clients include Saddle Creek, Mute, Barsuk, Warp, Dirtnap, PIAS, Don Giovanni and more. Recent records I've promoted include NOTHING's Tired of Tomorrow (Relapse), Charles Bradley's Changes (Daptone), Martha's Blisters in the Pit of My Heart (Dirtnap), and Beat Happening (Domino).
A journey of ethnomusicology including field and archival recordings, ritual music, international counterculture, interviews and live guests making traditional music from around the globe.

Studio Visit is a curated sound exhibition of PDX-area artists, art professionals, art lovers, and makers of all kinds. DJs Abi, Megan, and Michael host on alternating weeks, and each week a new guest joins the show for an exploration of their personal music tastes, creative process, and spontaneous daydreams. The show will be 1/3rd talk and 2/3rds music, and the music is eclectic by definition because weekly guests determine the playlist. The DJs engage guests in discussions about how music affects their artistic practice, which music obsessions they have and why, memories of the local music and art scene, and what makes them tick creatively in general. More of a casual conversation than an interview, Studio Visit desires to uncover hidden sides of the local art scene in an idiosyncratic, random and synesthetic way.
Sunday night nostalgia and film reverence. Past themes included “Wim Wenders,” “Motown Mother’s Day,” and “Florida.”

A clinic on psychedelic rock, stoner metal, krautrock and related and semi-related genres with an international bent. All that and more intercut with the ramblings of an antisocial music nerd and audio clips that make you think/laugh. 20+ minute long musical explorations being more common than your standard 2-3 minute pop song, with a hefty dose of unsigned and self promoted bands. Also features special episodes that diverge greatly from the norm.
